poem:
Black Friday, Unattended  

The streets, a breathless pause—  
each step echoes, hollow  
in the ribs of commerce.  

Signs, red slashes and promises,  
whisper to those who do not come.  
The mannequins wait,  
still as clouds,  
in shop windows,  

as the air questions  
what will bring us back,  
to the vibrant pulse of want.
